alert.note: Alert for Collin; Dallas; Denton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 06 at 7:50PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Texas, including the following counties, Collin, Dallas and Denton. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will likely cause urban and small stream flooding. Low lying and/or poor drainage areas will experience minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Dallas, Plano, Garland, Irving, Carrollton, Frisco, Richardson, Lewisville, Coppell, The Colony, Farmers Branch, Addison, Lake Lewisville, Little Elm, Hackberry, Hebron, Oak Point, Lakewood Village, Lewisville Lake and Buckingham.
